name: AD 1.2 — Memories
description:
“Tell me a story, tiger.”

One day we were a brother and a sister. It was spring, yet it was winter. She had a translucent skin, yet she wasn’t translucent hiding her thoughts behind the iron-strong armour.

A flash you wear is not who you are. We are all God’s creatures, and we are here for a purpose, my little friend.

“But you changed everything.”

“Yes, I did.”

We were just boys, we were young and stupid, and we were bad, and did disgusting things. We were unpretty. Now I have only one eye, and my burden in a closet. 

Why have I done it?

I don’t remember. Every qubit of my memories was burned, parts of it never merged in the same structures like it had been before.

I was riding on a freight from a bad place to a place that even worth, from bad behavior to dirt, out of any reasonable orbit. That’s what I still do, suffering every single second; just drifting in space, twirling, and torching, out of control, a homeless cat in a dark metal box, watching the stars.

“Isabella,” it whispers in my ear.

Your name is on a tip of my tongue still. Isabella. I still remember your warm breath, a musk smell of your neck. 

What have I done, mother? I don’t remember it, mother.
